review: For the same price paid including a glass of wine and dessert Legal Seafood did much better. I felt bad no for the food or the restaurant but for my friends who came from Colombia to eat "restaurant" ribs even though they had ribs days before at my house. They absolutely did not like it, it was only bones, no meat on it, they found the ribs spicy (they don't like spicy food).  I told them it was the rub since they don't use to, neither do I, eat ribs drench in sauce. I had the fish tacos and the pico the gallo on top made it worst, I love to enjoy the food but that pico was way too spicy.  I know what pico de gallo is and taste but that one was a little bit way too much spicy. Server, slow, and it was only Tuesday, restaurant was empty and don't know how to handle cash and credit card to split a check. Not coming back and will not recommend to friends or family.

My wife and I have now been to this Chili's a few times now, and each time we leave very satisfied! (the same goes for our experiences at the Reston, Harrisonburg, and Winchester locations) Here, it is better to sit in the bar area for we have found the staff to be a little more attentive. As long as they keep having the 2 for $20 dinner deals and draft beer specials, we'll continue to come back!
Bugs in food, raw chicken, poor customer service. It made me hate the whole franchise while i used to love it. Last time to eat such disgusting restaurant

Really... it's Chili's... I don't know what to say.  It's not like you get 5 star food at this place... but I will admit they give you decent service and decent price for some lunch deals.   I'm a fan of their sweet potato fries when they don't cover them in salt. It's hard to be healthy at this place... even their salads are full of sugar and carbs with all fruit and sweet dressing that goes on it.  Outside of all that... it's Chili's.  You go to Chili's to expect Chili's... so I can't complain.
Great server. Wanted something simple and scored big time with the chips and salsa. Finished on a sweet note with a single scoop of vanilla ice cream with chocolate sauce..... Just enough!

First one star review I have ever made.  I felt like the bartender was the only person working the majority of the night.  Service was very poor, a most of the employees were playing on their cell phones the majority of my visit.  Went to the restroom and finally saw other employees, but they seemed to be laughing and having fun with the manager instead of working.  No wonder the restaurant wasn't busy.   Food came out not tasting fresh, imagine that.  Much better options in the area, don't waste your time.

It was a Friday night, which means it was a full house. I was told it was a 5-10 minute wait repeatedly, and never once offered a seat at the bar since I was only a party of one. I eventually walked out irritated, frustrated, and starved.

Over the past four years every time I've been here has been a disaster. Rude, slow service, incorrect orders, you name it. I don't know how they stay open; must be the large amount of tourists in the area who don't know any better. Worst Chilis in America.

I went with a friend over lunch to celebrate her birthday. Service was so slow it took 45 min for food to arrive for 7 people. And we told them in advance of our time constraints (1hr). When we arrived there was no one in the resturaunt!! Other people were served ahead of us. The waitress said there was no one to help her serve food and the manager threw the server under the bus. Half our party received a credit and the rest did not. I don't plan to return anytime in the future- so disappoint!
Worst service ever. I'm so disappointed everytime I go in. Can't believe these people expect tips!!!

Ended up here totally by chance, and it wasn't half bad, but certainly not amazing. The $20 dinner for two is a real bargain, offering an appetizer and two entrees for that price. Our starter was the chips and guacamole. The chips were very thin and the guacamole was too icy cold and needed more lime. The chicken fajitas of course looked better in the picture but tasted pretty good. The baby back ribs are always a good choice and were very tender. Service was attentive and it looked like the staff works well as a team. All the bar tables now have a tablet which you can use to order and pay your tab, which is kind of gimmicky, but at least it puts you in control of paying your tab.

Had a great meal at Chili's last night. The chicken crispers w/ honey mustard is my standard order at Chili's, and it was awesome per usual. We ate in the bar area and the service was great! We had a coupon for a discount on margs that they hadn't seen before but went ahead and honored anyways, much appreciated!
The food was fine but only go if you have a few hours to eat! Was in for lunch, hardly no other people there, and service was non existent! Won't be back.

Turkey Sandwich on Texas Wheat Toast. Delicious! But after looking at the calories for it... I had to give it up. I ordered from the lower calorie menu and got the chile-mango chicken. It was pretty good. Not as good as my Turkey Sandwhich, but it had to do. The service is always good and if you register online at their website they will send you coupons for free apps and dessert. And on your birthday, they give you free dessert... whatever dessert you want. I love this place. It's not top of the line culinary arts here, but it's inexpensive food for great prices and great taste.

Came here on a Saturday evening (party of 4) because we were in the neighborhood and our kids want to eat Chili's.  The restaurant was pretty empty and when we were given a table we asked if we could have a booth, the host mumbled no and then a reason.  Looking around at all the empty booths we asked again, we got the same response.  Well what could we expect our food took forever and it wasn't worth the wait.  We only saw our Server when she took our order, brought our drinks, and after they brought the food.  We will not be back.

It was alright...Took a while to get the attention of the server...even with pushing the button that I needed her on their electronic device used to make orders. I ordered the skillet fried cinnabon pull apart dessert. It just gave me some cold lump of cinnamon biscuits and they just slapped the cinnabon logo to attract customers.

Soo... my review of another Chili's in Bailey's Crossroads and my absolutely horrible experience there led me to give them another shot at the behest of corporate. The service there was wonderful. We got the happy hour triple dipper samplers with mine being double boneless wings and southwestern egg rolls. They really gave me like 20 boneless wings which was so cool of them (should have gotten 8-9) and my bf got the sliders, wings, and tenders. Our waitress was very attentive and friendly and my faith has been restored in Chilis (this one at least). Oh, btw, for all of that our bill came out to under 15 dollars. Yay!
The service is horribly bad and the waiters are rude and the food was not an usual chilis   I am really speechless, simply the worst ever chilis I have ever been in

This Chili's has really awful, experience-ruining service, which seems to be a recurring theme among Crystal City/Pentagon City restaurants. The servers I've had are never happy, maybe that is indicative of the way their employers treat them, who knows.  In any case, expect to get ignored, have your order screwed up or even forgotten entirely, and have your party's dishes come out at all different times.  Avoid if possible.

What a horrible experience! We tried coming here after Legal Seafoods was busy next door. Our group and another group were quickly ignored at the host table for a group that came in a few minutes after us - I hate to say it was a race issue, but it was blatantly clear the host did not like any of the groups except the one he priority seated. Once seated our server came over and introduced the computer on the table as his "best friend". We should have taken his advice and used it because he forgot to put in our order at all. Food took over an hour to come out once he realized his mistake and tried to blame it elsewhere. He was extremely unattentive, never refilling our drinks. When the time came for checks, he forgot and then asked us to use the machine. We finally lost it on him and told him to bring us the checks to the table. He never returned to the table, but the manager did for a 50% discount. The manager had no idea any of this had happened. Great communication. Once the server never returned to the table we paid through the computer as we couldn't stand to be there any longer. 1- Avoid this place at all costs 2- It is pathetic that servers have lost all customer service ability and reality due to the presence of these server machines
I ordered the chicken crisper here for to go. I really like it! The chicken is yummy and served with fries and corn.

First time eating at Chilis and I didn't know what to expect.    There was a strange ambience inside the restaurant as half the staff seemed to just be going through the motions of the job and the other half of the staff were eager to serve.  Lucky for me, I got a good waiter I ordered a plain grilled chicken salad ( just chicken and lettuce ) and my guest ordered a steak meal.  Surprisingly, the steak meal was over $3 cheaper than my grilled chicken salad.   All in all , this is a chain restaurant and I am sure if you have gone to one you have gone to all.

The one time we are here, it was terrible! We ordered a meal and appetizer. After 15 minutes the waitress informed is that they had run out of the appetizer we ordered, and offered us another choice. We picked the boneless wings. After another 15 minutes, the wings came out. They were completely uncooked. So we asked for the manager, who took 10 minutes or so to come by and casually take the wings way. We paid for our drinks and left...

Way more expensive than I was expecting for a chilis, but the service was great and it was clean and not too loud. The food was decent, nothing more than you'd expect. The shrimp tacos are okay, spicy. I recommend the triple berry margarita. Also their salsa is probably the best thing, not sure what makes it so good but yum!

Service was friendly but slower then life itself! 13 minutes for a beer, 50 minutes for Honey Chipotle Crispers ... So far (still currently waiting on those chicken strips). It's frustrating because I am one of 4 people at the bar and I have an event to be at in an hour. Maybe a poor choice on my part to arrive at a restaurant at 7:30 hoping to be able to eat and leave within an hour.

Visiting  crystal city and I would not recommend this place. The service sucked an the guy who brought our food had sweat running down his entire face and head and our server swept while we ate. I'm not sure if you can put names up but our server had no people skills. I told the manger but I'm sure it doesn't matter because the server was too comfortable being rude.  Rant over. PS the food sucked
Restaraunt was empty on that Tuesday night.  Service was surprisingly slow for the number of people in the restaraunt.  The server was really friendly and the food was decent.

To quote a fellow Arlingtonian, "You can call it Trans-fat. I call it happiness." It's not that I'm low brow, or a bottom feeder... I just like a good grease bomb every now and then.  hoity toity restaurants have their place. But on a Friday Night after a long week of doing the Gov'ment's bidding, I need a place to unwind with a frosty beer mug and some fatty comfort food. There's peace in knowing that I will in no way be able to rationalize the terror that I am about to unleash on my stomach. Chili's usually keeps itself honest with this ideology, and I'm a huge fan of that.  Chili's isn't always the best at service, and the food there lacks a certain originality. But its not designed to woo you. Its designed to DESTROY you!  I came in for a Friday happy hour early and squatted on two bar tables at once. When the waiter asked me if I had a bigger group coming, I said yes, and he helped me rearrange the furniture to fit my incoming group. That was a class move, I thought. The Happy Hour here isn't bad at all...cheap drinks, low priced appetizers from the Happy Hour List. I ordered the Bacon Bigmouth Bites with ranch dressing and made sure to pester the server for more onion strings. He delivered, and with a smile. That goes a long way in my book.  It's noisy, but you know that. It's Chili's, not the Palm. I can't tell you how many times I've been to a Chili's over the years. There not all a homerun, that's for sure. But I have to say you know what you're going to get. I hope it's a massive Margarita that would make Michael Scott and the Dunder Mifflanites jealous, (and or sloshed), and the bacon Bigmouth Burger (that I immediately regretted not ordering). Ultimately, I find myself comparing every single burger I eat to something on the Chili's menu, and as Jules Winfield would say, "That's a tasty burger".
Not a bad choice when you are in the Arlington/DC area.  Great staff that knows how to work tourists--our server definitely helped make my wallet much lighter!

Ugh.  Chili's is where you want to go when you have absolutely no idea what you want to eat, and are fooled into thinking this is a good idea.  Every time I have been here, I've left dissatisfied and regret being hungry enough to walk through the door. The food is not special by any means. It's bland, tasteless, and worst of all, overpriced.  For example, the wings. Fried to produce a mediocre crispness, then bathed in a thin sauce of disappointment resembling Texas Pete hot sauce and butter. $10. Gone.  Don't let the menu pictures fool you, or the sound of the sizzling skillet. I learned the hard way by ordering chicken fajitas the other night. I mean- how do you screw up fajitas?! Well, Chili's apparently screws them up by adding zero seasoning, and upcharging you for rice and beans. They were terrible. I hated every second. $15. Gone.  So take my advice, if you're in Crystal City, and the thought of going here crosses your mind, immediately punch yourself in the face, and walk down the street to Kabob Palace.

My friend and I needed a place to chill for a few hours before our flight out, so why not chill and Chili's?  (Hold the applause). Was here on a Sunday afternoon and it was pretty much empty.  Nice!  There were a few people in the dining area and bar downing a few in the middle of the afternoon. Had myself a burger cooked medium rare.  I like how they actually cooked it how I ordered it, unlike many other places which overcook the meat. Fries are alright but the burger made up for the lack of stellar fries.   Can't really say much for the service except the our water kept getting refilled even if we finished eating and were just sitting there.  I like American places because they never really pressure you to leave or give you subtle hints like they stop checking up on you. Chili's Grill & Bar - 85 Points

So I went here for HH last night.   Let me tell you, I am a die hard fan of Chillis happy hour in general ( I'm a regular at the one in Bowie) but I'd never been to the one in VA. It was cool. At first I was turned off by the attitude of the bartender Bo, but he eventually came around. I guess he needed to know we were actually good tippers first Smh but then it was magic.  Chillis has AWESOME food and the prices are unmatched. 4 dollar appetizers. 3 dollars mixed drinks and wine. Just perfect.  And a triple dipper for only 6.50; that's 3 appetizers in 1. My boyfriend and I basically got one of everything and then some.. All in all I will be back even though I have to leave the city and venture to VA.

Worst Chili's Ever!  Terrible service, manager nonexistent. They're slow and rude and no one knows what is going on. Who runs this place and why are they still open??  (Btw, lived nearby is DC for 15 years and I try and come here occasionally and want to embrace this location like every other chili's - but they consistently underdeliver for everything)

This review is for the bar area, but the service is comically bad. We're currently waiting for our drinks and can see them at the bar, but no server is bringing them to our table. The restaurant isn't very full. The servers almost seem offended if you ask for anything.  I only did 2 stars because the wings and the southwest tacos are pretty good. Not worth coming back for though.
Your typical Chili's. The food and drinks came out fast, so that was a plus. They have good happy hour specials. The bartenders were nice and friendly.

This is an old stand by that still delivers quality bar food & related offerings. Their desserts look great too but I've never been able to finish my meal; thus I cannot justify ordering anything more. Plus, no dessert seems to fit well with my tall Blue Moon! :-)

Last week was my first visit to Arlington with my family, and we decided to stop in for dinner here on our first night. Our server handled our table great. He didn't write down any of our orders, and since it was a party of 7 I expected him to make at least one mistake. However, I was pleasantly surprised when everything came out perfect. He was attentive and kept our drinks filled the entire time. The food was great as well. I got the Monterey chicken, which was awesome. My family enjoyed the time together and we all left full and happy. If we are ever in the area again, I'm sure we'll make another stop in.

Let me preface this review by saying that if you're a visitor in crystal city, you should NEVER go here. There are enough good restaurants in this area that you shouldn't have to waste your money or allowed caloric intake at a gosh-darned Chili's. HOWEVER--that being said, this place offers something that most places in crystal city don't, which is a decent salad. I know that the salads here don't exactly qualify as health food, but sometimes you just need some greens, ya know? I've only been here twice, but I try to cut the calories by getting dressing on the side, holding the bacon, switching from fried to grilled chicken, etc. Chili's is Chili's, meaning they usually earn about a 1-star review. In this location, the pure existence of salads on their menus, combined with the fact that it holds the hours you would expect from a chain restaurant, means it gets an extra star.

If you're pressed for time at all, don't go here.  Every time we come here, the service is super slow. I always begin by telling the server that we are on a lunch break, so its not like they don't know. We go after the lunch rush, so there isn't a problem of the server being overwhelmed. They just all don't care, I guess.  The food has consistently been good, but then again, its Chili's. A chain. It SHOULD be good.  I am in love with the new lunch menu. The chicken enchalada soup warms my soul.

Upon entering this Chili's, I was freaked out by what was going on the moment I entered.  It was in the evening, and there were barely any people in the restaurant.  Same for the servers, barely any were visible.  Until we saw what was going on in the back of the restaurant, the servers were doing some sort of rap circle throw down.  Thought that was cool, until they just kept doing it and nobody came to serve us.  After 15 minutes, we walked out; they were still doing their flow. On another occasion, met a friend for lunch and got a burger at the bar area.  Good thing was we got served.  Not so good was the food.  Probably the most unmemorable food I have had at a Chili's before.  Not all Chili's are created equal.

I love, love, love salad from Chili's. I mean I am borderline obsessed with how tasty they are. Granted, I only order 3 ingredients (bacon, cheese, onion) on them, they are heavenly. And I go there at least once a week. I have never had bad service at this location and there has never been an issue with my food. I usually order a salad, potato skins and a strawberry mango frozen margarita and they are always perfect. (Though I imagine it'd be difficult to mess up either of those items)  The 2 for $20 or 2 for $35 (the option that includes a margarita) are the best ideas ever. I give this plae 4 stars only b/c there isnt an open parking lot, you have to pay for street parking anytime before 6 p.m or you have to park in one of the garages.

My frequent place.Most times i go for the Chilis to go and at times eat in.The service has always been good and the foods real good too.At times they do tend to cause you a P in the A for To Go orders if the restaurant is crowded and all are busy.There wouldn't be much advantage is ordering online during those times. Love the big mouth bites and the sweet potato fries.Chocolate lava cake is my fav dessert.
I generally appreciate Chili's, but I was disappointed with this location. The service was a bit slower than expected, and the food wasn't quite as good as the Richmond Hwy location.

Came back to DC to pick up my daughter. My sister and I visited this Chili's location on 08/01/14 and had the best wait person EVER. Her name was Simone and she was so personable, attentive and just plain fantastic. I came back with my daughter today 08/04/14 to pick up a to go order and she saw me and came over to say hi and meet my daughter. Simone is absolutely the best! Thanks for being one of the nicest people I met while on my trip here!

First off I know that Chili's is....well, Chili's. Food: 2/5 Service: 4/5 Atmosphere: 4/5 Parking: 0/5 Cleanliness: 4/5        No real explanation of food from such a large corporation should be necessary: It's 1.500 calories from a 2,000 calorie diet in one dish and doesn't even taste very good and is certainly not fresh. Everything is pre-made, canned, frozen, and industrialized in flavor and texture.          The primary problem here is the parking....in that it's non existent. We paid 10 dollars to park for less than an hour in the adjacent garage but, when trying to leave, we told they didn't accept real people money (credit cards) so we had to re-park, then find an ATM....there were no ATMs within a mile open as they're all behind doors so we bummed $6.00 off a friend to cover the $4.00 we already had in coin.....like living in a third world country, they should be ashamed of the parking situation here.          In conclusion, dreadful. Especially if you have a car, don't bother coming here.

Great food, terrible service. We got checked on about once the whole time. We got are orders taken and that was it, never a "do you need a refill" or anything! The worst part was we wanted dessert. And she never showed up! We had to order it from the little computer thing after waiting 15 minutes! It was horrible. It didn't help that she wasn't that kind either. Very disappointed,

Came here for a quick bite because I was staying down the street at the Hyatt. The service was by far the worst I've ever experienced at a chili's! The waiter was either new or just didn't care about his job. We got our appetizer, soup, salad, and entree all at the same time, he didn't check in with us once after he took the orders, and when the food arrived we asked for sour cream which took at least 15 mins to get. Definitely not going back!

I hadn't been to Chili's in a loooong time when I went the other day, so actually wasn't sure what to expect.  It was actually a very fine time!   We got the "2 for $20" special, a pretty good deal.  This included an appetizer (guac and chips, guac was interesting with corn in it and really large portion of chips) and two entrees (chicken fajitas and grilled chicken-something).  My fajitas were great, though I found it a little strange that they don't bring out rice with the fajitas.  Regardless, they were delicious.  Also had their pink sangria which was also pretty incredible, but came in a small portion and wasn't exactly cheap at $6.  Our server was friendly and pleasant, and most importantly, prompt.  We were both really exhausted and it was nice having a hearty meal served quickly and cheerily with no stressors.  Job well done! Last thing: I have an annoying tendency to lose my credit card at restaurants.  Most restaurants make the process of getting your credit card back extremely unpleasant and difficult (ie. make sure never to leave your stuff at Science Club, you will never see it again or receive any assistance whatsoever in tracking it down).  This Chili's was different however.  When I initially called the next morning the phone was answered and the friendly guy looked in the safe and didn't see it.  He took down my number "just in case" and said he would talk to some people, but I figured he was just being polite and wouldn't hear back from him.  I was pleasantly surprised near the end of the day when he called back and said he had found the credit card and put it in the safe.  Of all the times I have lost my credit card somewhere no restaurant has ever been that helpful before.  Good job Chili's!

Two for $20 meals are the best invention ever!!!  Came here for lunch on a Sunday and the place maybe had 10 people in it.  So service was pretty good since it was quiet. We came in a group of 8 and paired up for the 2 for $20 special.  I ordered the bacon cheeseburger to cure my hangover from the Park.  I also had the texas cheese fries as my app and it was a meal on its own.  I ordered my burger medium and it was cooked perfectly.  I was only able to eat half becasue of the cheese fries, so I had me a late afternoon snack. Overall well cooked meals for the entire table, no complaints, and excellent service!

Was there for a late lunch. Tried their new cyber pay system. I like it. User friendly. We had a nice server. Very personable and on top of her game. Food was fine. Only complaint is the sweet tea was NOT cold. Order a separate glass of ice if you are going to have the sweet iced tea. I'm sure I'll return time and again.

This review is for the delivery side of things.  First off don't order from this restaurant through  . It was a moment of weakness between me and my roommates today as we are all home sick from work. We didn't include a tip because we wanted to tip based on his service, given the already ridiculous delivery and service fees.  The driver was 2 hours late. He arrived a few min. ago and says we owe him cash. I said no I paid via credit card. He continues to aggressively argue with me about this. I go to get my phone to show him my emailed receipt and he interrupts "Where is my tip." I said "Tip??" He said, "Yes I need a tip" I had to forcefully tell him to first confirm with his manager that I indeed paid already and he proceeded to insinuate that we were trying to not pay when he called over his walkie talkie. I finally had to show him my bank statement on my phone to prove that I had indeed paid. He finally agreed. Then he refused to leave until we had tipped him. I told him he wasn't going to be getting one b/c he was so rude to us and had taken 2 hours to get us our food. He refused to leave until we had given him money. At this point, he was so threatening that I basically tried to shove a dollar at him (not very nice, I know, but I was so shocked by his attitude) He then decided to leave. What's more is they didn't even get the order right (and cold)!! When I tried to call they took a bit of money off but that was it. I won't be using this service or this restaurant delivery again.
The place is more of a family joint. Good place for kids and a few drinks. The service is good.

Had a great lunch here with some colleagues last week and it was mostly because of our waiter (Mario?). After a huge disappointment at Matsutake the day before, I suggested Chili's as the spot for a quick lunch during a week of meetings and conference on-site with clients. My usual Chili's experience is with the one in Baileys Crossroads (where the food can be hit or miss sometimes) but I knew that the menu would have something for everyone and most likely would be a solid, affordable and quick option. Wasn't disappointed.  We started with chips and then all opted for "sliders". Mine plain chicken crispers, my companions the bbq crispers and big bite burgers. (NOTE: the big bite burgers are just a regular hamburger patty that has been quartered.) Our server was nicely attentive and kept our glasses filled. The food came out fast and he was there when we needed but not when we didn't. I especially liked the jovial approach he had as he did his work. As we were leaving a see of young grade school children arrived, filling the section we'd been seated in. I made a comment to one of my co-workers about leaving before the volume reached an untenable level. Our waiter overheard, and just gave us a smile and a shrug and set about getting the large party settled with menus. If I'm trapped in Crystal City on business again - I'll almost assuredly be back for lunch. (NOTE: The map shows this place in completely the wrong location. Its located just off 23rd street in Crystal City - not over by 395 as the map shows.)

Yes...I know it's Chili's.  Like you really need a review about a chain restaurant that's pretty much in every city.  Nonetheless, I went here and was pleasantly surprised that they had free chicken bbq wings between 3-7 pm.  Also, their domestics on draft were only $2.50...woohoo.  That included Blue Moon...one of my favorite beers....a 2nd woohoo!!! Admittedly, the bar was kinda small and the seating was a bit crowded, but the service was friendly and my friends and I spent a total of $7 each which included a couple of appetizers, beer, and free wings.  Not a bad way to spend a Wednesday evening after work.
Horrible food, service and management. The crappy restaurant holy trinity.

Avoid this one. Submitted to go order via app. Order wasn't submitted until I got there and then bartender complained to a customer and shook his head at having to handle the order (and to-go orders in general). Too bad, he could have made a free tip. Too many other choices around here to deal with that nonsense.

I like the strawberry frozen margaritas here.  They are huge, inexpensive and very good.  The chips are good, too.  The main courses, though, are just average.  Parking is very difficult, especially at night.
Slow service. Rude wait staff. Unless you sit at the bar, you'll wait for 10-15 minutes for the hostess to appear. Just stay far away.

We decided to eat outside because the weather was gorgeous. The waiter takes our drink orders and I see a MOUSE running around our table! Turns out, this Chili's has outdoor MICE traps along the building and the MOUSE was running in and out of that thing. I froze and as soon as my husband stood in front of the trap to block the little bastard in there, I BOLTED out of that place and will never, ever go back there.  DINERS BEWARE! THEY HAVE MICE!

Service here is HORRIBLE. Never even made it to the food, the girl at the front door was so inept and rude we left.  Details if you need them: I was in town on business and staying at the hotel across the street. Not a big Chili's fan, but it was the only restaurant in sight from my hotel across the street. I stopped in 6/28/13 at about 8:30pm and the young woman working the reception was away from her station. I waited patiently. When she returned, she stepped around me and began helping the people second in line, who came in behind me. They were then seated. Uh, hello?  When she got back to me, she somewhat rudely asked if she could help me. I pointed out that I'd been there before the people she just seated, as I thought she should know. She dismissively said she didn't see me, though she had to have seen me - she actually had to vary her path to literally get *around* me - I was standing right in front of her podium! If she hadn't seen me, she would've run into me. But whatever. I asked for a table and she told me there was a 40 minute wait. What?? There was an empty table 10 feet behind her, not far inside the door. I rather stared at her, but couldn't even fathom why I'd bother to ask about it. By then I was so disgusted that there was no way I was spending a dime in this place. I immediately left.  There are other restaurants a few blocks away. I strongly urge you to look further. It'll be a long time before I set foot in another Chili's - this inept hostess ruined the brand for me.
Great food! I enjoyed the ambiance and also the staff were very friendly. I would highly recommend this place!

I'm giving this chain restaurant five stars for a few reasons.  First was the exceptional service I recieved from Novelle, my server on one occasion.   She was kind, attentive, and had a genuine warm smile.  And their day time bartender whose name I didn't catch on another occasion. Also, they have 25cent wings daily from 3-7 and $2 16oz. pints.   I haven't worked in a long time and a man still has to eat and drink!  Their side salad was fresh, they chop it and it has grilled corn which I think is a nice touch.    Their nachos are good too.    I've had crappy service at other chili's.   For example when I go back home and take my family out to dinner, but crystal city seems to be doing it right.
It was adequate. Good place to take kids who might not otherwise yet appreciate the nicer, more expensive restaurants in the area. Good standby option with safe menu choices.
I had a great time there on late Thursday at the bar area  and my server her name is Jackie, she was so nice and confidant and she gave us great service.

We were seated rather fast; however it took 15 minutes for a server to get out drink order. They were out of kids menus and didn't seem too accommodating to tell us  what was on the kids menu. Server was not at the table often and really didn't see much of her at other tables. Fajitas were not sizzling like they usually are (just  warm).  Not impressed with this Chili's at all...disappointed!

Food was typical Chili fare but the best part of our dinner experience was our great waitress, Jordan. She was so friendly and had such a positive attitude. She took great care of us and there were 9 in our party (5kids). Thank you, Jordan!

The wife and I ordered simple chips and salsa, southwest egg rolls, and chicken bacon ranch quesadilla. The salsa was watered down and the quesadilla was missing the ranch. Whenever we had an issue we could never find our waiter. Also good luck talking to the manager cause all he did all night was make circles in the restaurant looking at tables and not talking to anyone. Will never go here again!

You're never going to leave a Chili's happy that you spent your money there, and this one is no exception.  My girlfriend swears by the quesadilla explosion salad, so I guess if you like salads that have 1,000 calories, you might want to come here. On the other hand, they're not going to serve you anything inedible, you're going to get a large amount of food, and the service at this location is good.
Across the street from the Hilton.  The food was as expected but the chips were stale and I had to have my meal remade.

Well, you know, my lovely wife and I USED to be big fans of Chili's - because it was a reliable place to get a good, juicy Texas-style burger, tasty fries, reasonably good chili, and ice cold beer. But not any more. A few years back, Chili's must have been bought by somebody's overprotective mama, because they stopped serving burgers cooked to order. NO more medium-rare burgers, hot pink in the middle. NOSSUH!  Nanny Chili says they'll only cook their burgers medium or worse now. It's for our own good, you understand. We don't know what we want, we're just the customers. Says so right on their national website. Well, the hell with that. If they ever change their nannyburger policy, we'll go back. Till then, there's plenty of competitive burger joints out there who will fix a burger the way a hungry diner wants it.
Never order online. My order was due for pickup at 5:15. Its 5:31 and still waiting for an order of nachos and chili to go and the place isnt crowded.
Good food, but a little pricy.  The only bad thing about my experience was that they did not have steak sauce for my steak, and I always have to have steak sauce when I eat steak!

This rating is for the bar food and service at this particular Chilis. The bartenders are friendly and attentive.  25 cent wings and cheap happy hour beers make me love this place.  It is Chilis, but convenience and economy make this place a treat.

This was not a good experience overall, but let me start with saying that the service was the most disappointing. My boyfriend used to work at this Chili's a few years ago. Back then, he said that the majority of the waitstaff and managers were usually too doped up to be of much help and that they used to sell drugs to the tenants in the apartment complex upstairs. Maybe it's not like that anymore. My boyfriend and I came mid-afternoon (about 3:00) and it was practically empty. We sat in the dining area. Our server had a couple tables, but she didn't seem to have the time to take our drinks or food orders before she excessively talked up the tip with some military guys at another table. We ordered the chips and salsa (delicious as usual and my favorite!) which we quickly finished. Our server came and went with our food orders but didn't bring more chips until we asked her to. When I asked she seemed annoyed. By this point I know I was! My boyfriend's food came out with the wrong sides. When I mentioned that the side items were incorrect, the server tried to tell me that the kitchen put them on the plate and she didn't want to waste the food? I used to serve at a Chili's in Georgia. We were supposed to check the food before it was brought out to the table. If something was wrong, the cooks could easily fix it while it was still in the kitchen. This way the food would be salvaged and the customer would get the right order. I think our server just messed up the order and didn't want to admit it. Overall the food was O.K. for a Chili's. I have had a much better experience here when I've eaten at the bar (4 stars). My suggestion to anyone interested in trying this Chili's - eat at the bar tables or avoid this Chili's altogether.  I usually love Chili's food and atmosphere, but this particular Chili's didn't do it for me. There are plenty of delicious restaurants in Crystal City that cost less and are more enjoyable.
yum!! so good look for janita great service and great portion sizes. Convenient location near metro. Good lunch specials

When we got there yesterday evening for dinner, it wasn't overly busy around 6:00 on a Friday evening, the server was fairly quick when we got there but once we placed our order the indifference started.  Neither of us were big alcohol drinkers and we didn't want to waste our appetites on sugary soda, so we ordered water plus the $9.99 steak special, cooked rare.  I ordered the sweet potato fries with mine, she ordered the regular fries.  My order came out cooked correctly, but hers was overcooked to just beyond medium (slightly pink in the middle), so she sent it back.  The second plate brought to her was cooked to the same type of barely medium, so it was sent back again.  The third plate brought out was cooked rare, bordering on raw and was cold on the inside.  One of the managers was bringing the food out the second and third times, and on the third attempt my fiance said forget about it and ate the nearly raw steak.  When we got the bill, we were charged for both orders, and no discount was offered by anyone.  This was unacceptable and no tip was left for the server due to ineptitude and complete disregard for the customer.  Clearly the server was not properly trained in true customer service, and more than likely we will not be going back to this one any time soon.

I once went to Chili's with a former associate. The Black female kept speaking to Blonde lady with me.  When she bought the receipt she gave it to her, like Black men have no money!  And, I was not dressed down. Also, the guy cleaned the table after we sat down with wet rag!  I was sent free coupons after I complained, but they went in the trash because the burger and other food was disgusting! Believe it or not, I thought my lady friend said they sold chili.

Horrible service, in fact after I received my drink at the bar, 2 young ladies came up and after 10 minutes they left because they didn't even get a hello or asked for what they were drinking.  Food was ok and my beer was flat.  Would NOT come here again.

Chili's is....well, Chili's.  A few years ago, I'd come here for the happy hour for free wings between 3-7 (which they still ongoing, btw) which made for a cheap dinner.  I stopped going last year but I'm glad I came last night because the chicken ranch sandwich is so good (they put buffalo wing sauce on it so gives it a bit of a kick).  Besides the wings, it's the only item I can really stomach at this establishment.  I also like the strawberry lemonade - free unlimited refills.   Service is hit or miss and it was particularly poor last night because the bar area was packed.

MMMM...Chili's. This was always may favorite chain. I have grown out of it lately, but I still crave it once in awhile. I love the guiltless chicken platter. Yummmmm. They also have great southwest eggrolls and shanghai chicken wings for appetizers.

Service here was terrible. It took almost 2 hours for a party of 5. We had to specifically ask for drinks several times, orders were wrong and missing items, no napkins...and some items were cold. Also, our server wasn't exactly rude, but it almost seemed as though we were bothering him, right from the start. This is definitely crossed off our list of places to go back to.

I don't think I have ever called up a restaurant for a to-go and been told to go someplace else and not even in a nice way. I have food allergies so my choices are limited. What if I can't eat at other restaurants because of them? What a joke! I will never order from here ever after that.  Clearly new management is needed if they can't even take a simple to-go order. It wasn't even the dinner rush. NEVER GO HERE!

My boyfriend and I stopped by this Chili's this weekend out of hunger and convenience, but I wish we'd just gone elsewhere as the service was ridiculously slow. Since we didn't eat lunch until 2:30 that day there were only about 15 people in the entire restaurant but it also must have been staff nap time because it took 10 minutes to get drinks, then another 20 to get our salads. There's really no excuse for that unless they had to grow the lettuce or behead and pluck the chicken before chopping it up and grilling it. Our waiter was also very likely high, which I can't really blame him, but it was annoying since I didn't feel like frittering away a whole hour at this place. Next time I'll walk around the corner to Chipotle if I need a quick bite in the area.

Why you gotta do this to me Chilis!!! :(  I love Chilis and have been to tons of locations all over the U.S., and I was so excited when I found out there was one close by me.   If there is one thing this Chilis has taught me, it is that not all Chilis are created equal.  This Chilis is utterly awful.  I have been here several times, hoping that it redeems itself, but it is no use.  Every time I have been here, the Chilis is always empty(not a good sign) and the food is horrible.  The times that I have dined in the food has always been cold, soggy, or they have just been out of food.  It's weird for a place that boasts all its Marg concoctions, would be out of margs mix and tequila.  It's even more weird that they were out of soda, and actually had to send someone to a convenience store to buy bottles of soda because they were out.  They have been out of burger patties, buns, etc.  Even when we have done take out from them, everything is gone wrong.  From the limpy, floppy fries, to the soggy burgers, and burnt mozzerella sticks, it's just bad.  I want to like this place sooo much, but it's horrible.  The only thing that was decent was when we ordered out was that they gave us a huge bag of chips with queso, but that's not what I'm coming to Chilis for.  There is obviously a disconnect with the management, because usually all the staff is in-sync and upbeat and here everyone looks like they hate their job.  The service is even worse.  When there were only 5 tables  being serviced, we waited over two hours for burgers.  Something is definitely wrong with this place.

Strolling around DC, lookin to get full, hit up that chili's, open the door via a pull.  Order that salad, waitin paitently, waiter brings that food, it looks straight up princely.  Waiter comes by later, in the process of eating, brings me a new salad, my heart is swooning. First salad had no chicken, got 2 for the price of one, its things like this Chili's, that make me like you son.

When I have a craving for chips and salsa and the taste of grilled flavor, I visit the Chili's Bar and Grill in Arlington, VA. My visits there are great except for one thing:  The service is AWFUL!  I have gone a number of times alone, and I waited upwards of 30 minutes for a bill or a carryout bag.  I got the attention of the manager twice in recent visits because the service has not improved...even after continuous visits and awareness.  I love the food, but I have decreased my visits because I just don't have all day to waste!

Is it Friday? Too many happy hours during the week? Need something a on the healthy side that won't put you to sleep? Try the Guiltless Black Bean Burger from Chili's. This is a meatless black bean patty topped with low fat ranch, shredded lettuce, tomato, pickle and onion, weighing in at about 630 calories. It came with some veggies that were okay (too much salt, some what bland, hence, 3 stars), but the burger was definitely satisfied a Friday afternoon lunch craving.
This was a nice walk from the hotel.  There was typical Chili's fare. Some of it smelled so savory and tempting. We indulged. The star of the show was the company at the table.
Love the 2 for $20. The chocolate molten cake is delish.   Great service ;0)

This place is awful, even for a Chili's.  Service is horrifically slow, the wait staff is rude, and the greasy food always makes me feel terrible afterwards.  There's better choices in Crystal City.  Go to Ted's Montana Grill if you want a good burger

3 stars for food and 4 stars for service. My friends and I came here 30 minutes before close after a long flight. Honestly, it was the only place we could find that was open around the DCA area.  At this late in the evening, we set our expectations low. We just needed some sustenance to satiate our hunger. Surprisingly though, we had a really attentive server who provided great service despite dining until 30 minutes past closing time. We got the Texas fries and onion rings as apps. Both were delicious. I'd recommend getting either or both if you're here. Where things fell relatively short was the entree. I ordered the mango tilapia which comes with brown rice and steamed vegetables on the side. Flavors were ok...the tilapia was clearly frozen and defrosted, the vegetables needed a couple more minutes of steaming and were old, and the brown rice didn't really taste like anything. Our party of four ended up leave with a bill around $50 including drinks so I can't really complain about the price. It's definitely a great place for apps and food is reasonably priced.

Honestly this restaurant deserve 0 stars. I dined in at this restaurant tonight with my family while on vacation from out of state and after witnessing the server take our appetizers to the wrong table and then bring the exact order to us we knew this place was disgusting. I can understand a restaurant not wanting to waste product; however, the restaurant also expects that business goes well. And in order to achieve great results you have to put in great efforts... I asked the server politely if they could remake the order and the server was combative and argued with me. I asked to speak to the manager and he said that he was one of the mangers. Wow! Surprising, so I asked to speak with another manager. He went to the back, came back out, and apologized about his actions and said that it would be 10 minutes for a fresh order. I appreciated his apology and it made the experience a little better.  After 10 minutes a new server brought the appetizers out and I tasted the Texas style fries, and the fries tasted reheated and old: anyone who loves fries knows the difference between fresh and old fries. After realizing that the exact order was re-served to us when the walking manager came and asked how our experience was I explained the issue. He said he was a general manager from another store filling in because they were short staffed here, and he had the general manager come over and speak to us. I explained to her what we experienced and as the GENERAL MANAGER she argued with me.  I just couldn't believe how bad of a customer experience this was! I wouldn't recommend anyone to eat here.

This place was in a prime location. Maybe it closed because the food was not good, service was poor and management did not read Yelp to see the problems? When the average is 2.5 stars and management does nothing to change...this is the result.

It's a chili's. I don't know what people expect. This isn't a five star style restaurant. It's good food, screaming kids and minimum wage workers.   So,  four  stars for your basic chili's experience.  The customer service was good,  the food was good,  it was convenient.   I think they did a fine job.  It's relative.

Chilis is a great place for Mexican food. Love the chicken bowls, chicken flat bread, jalapeño fries, mango chile chicken, shrimp tacos! I have to say, they have a big menu, but most of the food is really good!

Stopped by here before work. Was seated for about 15 minutes before anyone came to us. Thought we would be smart and order drinks a food together. (Hell, we've had plenty of time to look at the menu)  The wait staff looked TERRIBLE. Everyone looked like they had been working for days nonstop. Our waitress was friendly but VERY slow. Even to just get us napkins seemed to take forever.  The two stars I give this location is to the cooks. Steak was cooked PERFECTLY. As for the bartender: a glass of whiskey isn't a mixed drink. It's just 3 shots.

I have never visited this location, and I am unsure if I will again. After being Ina one day conference at an adjacent hotel, it was assumed that this restaurant would be able to accommodate those who desired to eat at this location with more than likely large groups (5 or more). A a party of 7 in a restaurant that appeared to be 30% at capacity, we waited almost 30 minutes before we asked a server if we could just take an empty table. I was notified by one of the servers that they were without a hostess. They also appeared to be understaffed, which both attributed to the unnecessary wait time. When we did sit, our server made her best attempt to try to take care of our table, which is why we stayed and ate. This location needs more staff present to accommodate the patrons.

I really wanted to like this Chili's location.  My bf and I visited on a Saturday around 5pm and it was somewhat empty.   As always, I ordered a big strawberry margarita (and my bf ordered the equally as impressive El President margarita) and truly enjoyed it.  The drinks were great, and are the major reason I'm giving this review 2 stars instead of 1.   The food was OK too (for the most part...) - we ordered tableside guacamole, which was prepared in front of us and tasted fresh.  We also ordered the Southwestern Eggrolls (crispy flour tortilla filled with smoked chicken, blacked beans, corn, jalapeño jack cheese, red peppers, and spinach, served with an avocado ranch dressing). This was tasty too.   However when it came to entrees, I ordered the steak (classic rib eye with steamed broccoli and mashed potatoes) and was looking forward to this but our waiter brought it by and I saw his fingers touching my food... like sauce all over his fingers because his fingers were literally in my steak.  I tried eating the other side of the steak but was thoroughly disgusted at this point and didn't eat my entree.  That ruined the experience and we paid for our meal without saying anything and left.  I think the restaurant should  reevaluate its hygienic practices and instruct its employees on sanitary serving.  I doubt I would return to this Chili's, and it's a shame because I loved their drinks and the food I did eat was tasty. I also have historically really enjoyed other Chili's locations. Oh well. Oh, and just a tip - the parking situation in this area is somewhat of a mess and we ended up finding parking at a nearby labyrinthine parking lot.

I highly dislike giving 1 star reviews. However, the lack of customer service in this Chili's is worth noting. A group of 7 people ordered lunch when the restaurant was probably at 20% capacity. Our food took 1 hour to arrive and when I complained that my food was cold, the manager gave me a bit of attitude saying the kitchen had a mechanical failure while our food was cooking and my tacos were cooked already so they were sitting by a heating lamp while the rest of my colleagues food was prepared.  Food was cold and tasteless. Customer service was terrible. To top it off, we all had to "check ourselves out" by paying in a device (where we each had to find our order).  Do not recommend. There are way better lunch options in this area.

Chili's forgot to add flavor!!! After deciding to head here for lunch, I was quickly turned off. The service was good. Brittani was the waitress. She was nice and accommodating. I ordered the lunch size chicken fajitas. It tasted like I ordered bread and flesh. This was some "gamey" tasting chicken. I feel as though this chicken resided near the Potomac River and was recently murdered before coming to my lunch plate. It certainly missed the kitchen to receive any spice or savory seasoning. Absent, the great customer service, I'd likely not come back. Perhaps, it was an off day. I typically like Chili's. Hopefully, next time will be better.

This was my worst dining experience EVER! I thought going to a Chili's would be a safe choice but I was wrong. Our server was unpleasant and everything came out on a delay. If that was the worse of it all would've been well. The appetizer came out without plates. We waited a while for them while our food got cold then when we got them, the plates weren't clean. I got my wine and it had fingerprints all over the glass and food residue was next to the rim left over from someone else's lips! Then the food came and the rim of every plate was atrocious with dirty smudges and water marks. I was so grossed out. The manager claimed she will have a meeting with her employees about cleaning the dishes. This is unacceptable. I will NEVER go to this location again and from the reviews I see they should be shut down. Disgusting.

Complete lack of customer service, period. We sat at table, and waiting begun....for 15 minutes without anyone coming to our table.  Interestingly the place was about 40% capacity.  I found this tablet thing to see menu and order, pressed for "service", red lights go on...no ones coming.  We observed that people sitting around us weren't getting any service at all. After multiple attempts to get someone's attention, we finally gave us, and we walked out.  I know DC area isn't known for customer service and Chillies sets new standard.

Decent Mexican food and good burgers. The new menu is a big improvement. I especially like the chicken enchiladas with green chile sauce. Service is good although it took awhile to get seated despite plenty of open tables.

So my mom gave me a Chili's gift card for Xmas like 2 years ago. And the BF and I were in Crystal City last weekend and trying to eat on the cheap. So that is how we wound up here - aiming for a bite to eat that would not go over $15 (the value of the gift card). The overall problem with Chili's is that they don't have good food. Seriously, the skillet queso is like the only worthy thing on their menu. Ok, maybe that's a tad harsh. It ain't all bad. But it's not exactly quality food either. The problem with this particular Chili's is the lack of service. And I do mean a serious lack of service. We sat at our table for at least 10 minutes before anyone came over. Our drinks were slow to arrive. Our food was very fast to arrive. We were checked on just once, which was immediately after our food arrived. Our check had to be flagged down. Sure, I've experienced worse. But meh, it shouldn't have been that lacking. So yeah, not a fan of this Chili's location (or really any Chili's - except for the skillet queso).

Worst. Chili's. Ever.  We ordered the 2 for $20 and got the guac with chips and salsa, chicken fajitas, and the 6oz sirloin. What we really got was sour guac with a weird tangy salsa and ok chips. Those grilled chicken strips you can get in a sealable bag? That's why the fajitas are like with an added side of cold tortillas, and gross green peppers. Barf.  The steak was the saddest, driest, and grave looking thing I've ever seen. It came with salty broccoli and some cheese with a little mashed potatoes underneath. Bad. All bad.

The meal is not over, and I am waiting a refill on the water. The food is GREAT. I got this Chile chicken with avocado over Chile lime rice.  It took a while for them to serve the food and drinks.  In a nutshell, the food was well prepared and could have been the reason for how slow it was served. Unfortunately, it does not explain the how slow it is to serve water.  Five star of the service was faster.

Food: 0 stars Parking: 0 stars Service: 2 stars Venue: 4 stars We went here on a saturday night and got the $20 for two dinner deal. We ordered the chicken stripes, and the Cajun pasta. The chicken was so saucy it was eatable. The fries that came with it was really soggy and made you feel suck. The corn on the cob was basically so soggy they basically probably left it in water the entire day.  The cajun pasta was way too saucy. It was so drench in Alfredo sauce that you felt sick to your stomach. The garlic bread was brunt on one side.  The only thing we liked was the strawberry lemonade. The waiter was super nice. However, the food was super gross. Don't come here. EVER.

It's a Chili's...so don't show up expecting 5 star food or 5 star service.  Now, the service COULD be 5 star I suppose...but it's just  "not" at this location. I will say that their appetizers and side items are usually pretty good, (that's mainly what I order when I go).    They have some tasty sweet potato fries that are seasoned with Parmesan and garlic,  and I rather enjoy their mini-burgers and southwestern egg rolls!  The ribs here are "decent". I'm usually seated pretty quickly as I opt for the bar area.  Speaking of which, I can recall sitting in one of the booths once and the bar tender was pretty much our server too.  Bear in mind that this was during lunch time and the bar wasn't exactly crowded.  There were some ladies at the bar who were being over-flirtatious, probably trying to get free drinks :-/  Whatever they were doing was working because it was like pulling teeth to get his attention for a re-fill!  Pitiful.  My coworkers and I were so frustrated that we just asked for the check and left...refill-less!  Restroom was pretty clean.  Overall, a clean establishment. If you're driving, there's street parking and also a parking garage nearby.
Service was a little slow, considering that it was early and they weren't even 1/3 full. Food was pretty standard for a Chili's.

In my opinion, Chili's is only good for one thing. ..Happy Hour. Decent alcohol prices with half off appetizers (except for the sampler.) Food is a little below the just ok standard and wait staff was friendly but neglectful. There's a tablet at the table to take your orders which is cool.
